page.title: 14COMMUTING FROM HERNE BAY
page.content: Since the War the increasing price of property in London, added to the speed of travel after electrification of the railways prompted many London workers to live well outside the capital and travel daily by rail. Although it is about sixty miles from London many people commute from Herne Bay and the station is particularly busy between 7 and 8 a.m. and between 6 and 7 p.m.. From our class of 28 pupils at Hampton three had parents (two fathers and one mother) who travelled daily to London. One worked in a bank, one for the B.B.C. and one for British Rail. Although it means a very long day most commuters say that if they have to work in London they would rather live in the country near the coast. In this Block many commuters live in the Beltinge area because although further to the station the houses are good.
